sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词均有"显著的，引人注意的"之意。
means: outstanding ： 通常指与同行或同类的人相比显得优秀或杰出，或具有他人或别的事物所没有的特征。
noticeable ： 指所描绘的事物引人注意。
remarkable ： 通常指因有与众不同的特点或优越性而引起人们注意或称道。
conspicuous ： 通常指因成绩卓著，而引人注意，或指因外观奇特、花哨或言行举止不合常规而令人注意。
striking ： 侧重能给观察者产生强烈而深刻印象。

sentence.Network_en: He made a remarkable recovery from a shin injury.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的胫骨伤恢复得相当不错。

sentence.Network_en: He has displayed remarkable courage in his efforts to reform the party.
sentence.Network_cn: 在政党改革中，他表现出了非凡的勇气。

sentence.Network_en: The father of one victim spoke with remarkable magnanimity.
sentence.Network_cn: 一名受害者的父亲以极为宽容的口吻发了言。

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent.: from French remarquable, from remarquer 'take note of' (see remark)

entry.tran: 不同寻常的;非凡的;引人注目的
entry.def: Someone or something that is remarkable is unusual or special in a way that makes people notice them and be surprised or impressed.

sentences.sentence: "such poise is singular in one so young"
"a noteworthy fact is that her students rarely complain"

auth_sentence.content: This has been a really remarkable period of time.
auth_sentence.res_content: This has been a really remarkable period of time.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This has been a really remarkable period of time.

auth_sentence.content: It's impressive but it's not that remarkable.
auth_sentence.res_content: It's impressive but it's not that remarkable.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It's impressive but it's not that remarkable.

auth_sentence.content: It is neither remarkable or unusual, he said.
auth_sentence.res_content: It is neither remarkable or unusual, he said.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It is neither remarkable or unusual, he said.

Sentence.sentence: Remarkable changes have taken place in the book business.
But the remarkable thing is how well the system usually works
J's (Biography of John Muir)-John Muir's own writings to bring readers a life story of this remarkable man who did so much to raise American's awareness of environmental issues.
It is too remarkable to be measured.
It's rather remarkable for the fact that although it's extremely big, it's supported by just six rather slim legs.

jushi.english: She showed remarkable courage when she heard the bad news.
jushi.chinese: 她听到这坏消息时，表现出非凡的勇气。

jushi.english: The boy shows remarkable ability at mathematics.
jushi.chinese: 这男孩显示出非凡的数学才能。

jushi.english: I owe the restoration of my hearing to this remarkable new technique.
jushi.chinese: 我之所以能恢复听觉完全是因为采用了这项非凡的新技术。
